isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Crankcase, Crankshaft, and Camshaft - Installation - Main Bearings and Caps

calloutgroup.callout1: Rounded end of main bearing caps
M15 x 162 main bearing cap bolt (14)

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, use new main bearing cap bolts whenever main bearing cap bolts that have been torqued to yield are removed.

note.para: Thrust main bearing is only located on the crankcase # 7 upper main bearing saddle. All seven lower bearings are the same part number.

step1.para: Clean all Plastigage® and marker paste from main bearing and crankshaft journal surfaces.
Coat all main bearing journal surfaces with clean engine oil.
Lightly coat new main bearing cap bolts with clean engine oil (coat threads and under bolt head).

note.para: Main bearing cap rounded ends go toward the cam or exhaust side of the crankcase. Match the upper and lower main bearing tabs on the cam side of the engine.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, match and orient each main bearing cap with its corresponding number stamped in the crankcase. Install #1 main bearing cap on the front main bearing journal and install remaining main bearing caps numbered from the front of the engine to the rear (# 7).

step1.para: Install seven main bearing cap assemblies in their corresponding crankcase saddles. Make sure number on each bearing cap is correctly oriented and matches its corresponding number stamped in the crankcase.

Install fourteen new M15 x 162 main bearing cap bolts and finger tighten. See Torque Procedure for Torque-to-yield Main Bearing Cap Bolts
.
